metadata.title: CVE-2021-3420 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in newlib in versions prior to 4.0.0. Improper overflowvalidation in the memory allocation functions mEMALIGn, pvALLOc,nano_memalign, nano_valloc, nano_pvalloc could case an integer overflow,leading to an allocation of a small buffer and then to a heap-based bufferoverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcc-snapshot - 20230718-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: newlib package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-snapshot package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20230718-1ubuntu1').
